customer_addr:
S 9910 County Rd G
Augusta, WI 54722

citations.narrative:
Fourteen of the adult dogs in the kennel are not properly identified by a tag, tattoo, or microchip. Not having proper
identification on all adult dogs doesn't ensure the dogs can be easily identified and traced by an APHIS official. All adult
dogs must be identified by tag, tattoo, or microchip. Correct by 5/16/24.

Five puppies were in an enclosure that measured 42'' X 31" for a total of 1,302 square inches of space. Three of the
puppies measured 12'' and two measured 11''. The five puppies together required 1,550 square inches of space. Their
enclosure was short by 248 square inches of space. Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to
move about freely within their enclosures. It minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also
minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough
floor space to meet the minimum floor space requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 5/2/24.

A complete physical exam of all the adult dogs has not been completed in the past year. Not having the physical exams
completed doesn't ensure that adequate veterinary care is being provided to the dogs. The licensee must have the
Attending Veterinarian conduct annual exams on all the adult dogs. Correct by 6/2/24.

None of the adult dogs are current on their distemper and parvo vaccines. In addition, no dogs have been sampled for
heartworm or fecal parasites in the past year. Not vaccinating all adults dogs and not sampling the adult dogs for
parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adult dogs must be
vaccinated for distemper and parvo and must be sampled for parasites in accordance with a plan from the Attending
Veterinarian. Correct by 6/2/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Fourteen of the adult dogs in the kennel are not properly identified by a tag, tattoo, or microchip. Not having proper 
identification on all adult dogs doesn't ensure the dogs can be easily identified and traced by an APHIS official. All adult 
dogs must be identified by tag, tattoo, or microchip. Correct by 5/16/24. 
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Five puppies were in an enclosure that measured 42'' X 31" for a total of 1,302 square inches of space. Three of the 
puppies measured 12'' and two measured 11''. The five puppies together required 1,550 square inches of space. Their 
enclosure was short by 248 square inches of space. Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to 
move about freely within their enclosures. It minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also 
minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough 
floor space to meet the minimum floor space requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
Correct starting on 5/2/24. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A complete physical exam of all the adult dogs has not been completed in the past year. Not having the physical exams 
completed doesn't ensure that adequate veterinary care is being provided to the dogs. The licensee must have the 
Attending Veterinarian conduct annual exams on all the adult dogs. Correct by 6/2/24. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
None of the adult dogs are current on their distemper and parvo vaccines. In addition, no dogs have been sampled for 
heartworm or fecal parasites in the past year. Not vaccinating all adults dogs and not sampling the adult dogs for 
parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adult dogs must be 
vaccinated for distemper and parvo and must be sampled for parasites in accordance with a plan from the Attending 
Veterinarian. Correct by 6/2/24.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
